src:
Mhoni Vidente hace predicción del Canelo a horas de su pelea
Esta noche El Canelo se enfrentará en el ring de box ante el ruso Sergey Kovalev, una pelea bastante anticipada
02 Nov 2019, 17:50 by Por  El Debate
México.- Hace unas semanas, Mhoni Vidente, hizo una predicción a cerca de la pelea de Saúl “Canelo” Álvarez, misma que en las últimas horas reavivó para recordar el pronóstico que dio en aquella ocasión.
Esta noche El Canelo se enfrentará en el ring de box ante el ruso Sergey Kovalev, una pelea bastante anticipada y que había postergado su fecha.




Mhoni Vidente dijo en aquella ocasión en el programa “Hoy”: “El Canelo que ahora sí ya tiene pelea para este dos de noviembre contra un ruso que va a tener que subir de categoría, como siete kilos más el Canelo para subir a esa categoría…”
La popularidad de Saúl Álvarez se ha visto afectada, por lo que el perder en esta pela de box , podría perjudicar aún más su carrera y aceptación con el público, sin embargo Mhoni predijo que El Canelo ganaría la batalla.



“Finalmente yo veo que el Canelo viene ganando aunque el ruso como quiera está bien preparado pero el Canelo está en su mejor momento, 29 años, las ha ganado todas, va a tener que subir de peso pero es muy disciplinado y acuérdense que cuando uno es disciplinado siempre llegas al éxito constantemente”, aseveró.
Incluso anticipó al round en el que Canelo vencería la pelea; “El Canelo viene ganando la pelea de box entre el séptimo o noveno round con un knock-out y eso que se va a poner fuerte”.








Mhoni Vidente


El Canelo


Box
text:
Carmen and Juan, a date in the cemetery
The Spaniard said he felt something was broken.
02 Nov 2019, 17:00 by AFP
"The feeling is that I have broken something," said Rafael Nadal, number 2 of the ATP ranking, after retiring this Saturday just before his semifinal at the 1000 Masters in Paris for "abdominal pain."
"In the last service of my warm-up this morning I felt something in my abs. I go home to do the tests, you have to wait a few days to see what I have, I don't think it's serious according to the doctors," he explained.
"Some small fiber has jumped. The feeling is that I have broken something. We will have to wait 48 hours to do a real test and see how things are going," he said.
The Spaniard, who had not played any official tournament since his victory in the US Open for a left hand injury, had to face Canadian Denis Shapovalov (N.28) to try to reach Novak Djokovic in the final of this tournament that never He has conquered.
"For now I have to recover and depending on that will be the calendar. We hope you can play for London (Masters, November 10-17), is the goal," he added.
In this way, the Canadian will face Serbian on Sunday in the match for the title, after Djokovic eliminated a little earlier the Bulgarian Grigor Dimitrov (N.27) by 7-6 (7/5), 6-4.
Nadal's stormy history with the Paris tournament adds a new chapter, after being forced to resign several times. It was the first time in six years that he reached the semifinals.
Absolute king of Roland Garros, where he has won twelve times, the Balearic has never touched the roof of Bercy. In 2007 he reached his only final, which he lost against Argentina's David Nalbandian.
This abandonment revives the suspense for the fight for the first world position at the end of the year, which are disputed by Djokovic and Nadal, who is assured of returning to the top of the ranking on Monday.
